column4: hi guys, i'm having problems with sound since the last kernel upgrade, i have an intel based sound chip on my laptop motherboard - any clues how to start debugging this?
please read http://www.linux-sound.info/alsa/index.php?task=support and tell me the URL of the paste generated by the alsa-info.sh script linked from that page.
ok - two secs and i'll ber back
mmm i can't run that script i get a syntax error: bad substitution
prepend bash
http://pastebin.ca/559790
looking.
your 'PCM' is muted and zeroed
and what does that mean :)
it means your sound volume is muted and set to zero.
do this in a Terminal: amixer set 'PCM' unmute && amixer set 'PCM' 80%
well that would explain no sound . . . but my master volume is set to 80 per cent and i have the control turned up
(or you may use the volume control/mixer applet in the upper right corner of the top panel)
on some devices, 'Master' and 'PCM' are completely separate.
status update?
hey thats great thanks - i had to type 'sudo amixer set PCM on'
and then  'sudo amixer set PCM 30'
it wouldn't work without sudo prepended?
and now all works (i didn' try without sudo)
you shouldn't need sudo for that, but ok.
but thanks for your help man :)
np
incidentally how would my PCM have got set to zero?
some applications mistakenly do it.
